node.title: When Sarah's inflammatory disease flared, this specialist clinic saved her dreams of a second child
node.alt: A young girl plays with colorful plastic toys on a rug with her mum.
node.description: Thousands of Australians with inflammatory bowel diseases think they can't safely fall pregnant, but a specialist clinic is making that possible.
node.content:
["Many Australians with an inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) opt not to have children due to concerns their condition may impact the pregnancy. Now a specialist unit at the Royal Melbourne Hospital is giving families the information and support they need to have children safely.\u00a0", "Associate Professor Britt Christensen helps run the IBD pregnancy clinic and says the work is incredibly rewarding.", "\"The best thing for me is helping\u00a0these women who were hesitant about having children due to fear that they couldn't get pregnant or that it was too risky,\" she said.", "\"Getting a woman through a whole pregnancy and then they have healthy babies at the end of it \u2013 that is life changing for them.\"", "
IBD affects 75,000 Australians
", "IBD generally consists of two conditions \u2013 Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis.", "They are both lifelong autoimmune diseases where the immune system attacks the bowels.", "Well-managed patients can live with\u00a0few symptoms\u00a0but, left untreated, the conditions\u00a0can be debilitating.", "According to Dr Christensen, Australia has one of the highest rates of IBD in the world, with more than one in 200 people affected.", "\"It causes diarrhoea, increased bowel frequency and urgency, bleeding, fatigue and severe abdominal pain.\"", "People are generally diagnosed with IBD conditions between the ages of 16 and 40 \u2013 their peak reproductive years.", "If the condition is in \"deep remission\" women can have an uncomplicated pregnancy.", "For those who have active disease before conceiving, there is a risk their condition could deteriorate.", "The babies are also at increased risk of being born early or being born with at a smaller weight \u2013 which can lead to admission to a neonatal intensive care unit or developmental issues.", "
'I felt supported'
", "Sarah Zerbib, a mother of two, was diagnosed with an IBD in her teens.", "For most of her 20s and 30s she was in deep remission.", "When she became pregnant with her first child five years ago, she wasn't \"too worried\" about complications.", "The pregnancy went smoothly, however after she gave birth Ms Zerbib had a serious flare up.", "\"Because I wasn't aware of the risks that came as a very big surprise,\" she said.", "\"I became very unwell.\"", "Before she conceived her second child, she was referred to the Royal Melbourne Hospital (RMH) IBD pregnancy clinic.", "They made \"a massive difference\", she said, helping\u00a0her recover from the flare up and advising\u00a0her when she was healthy enough to try to conceive.", "\"I was very informed.\u00a0I felt very well cared for from all angles,\" she said.", "", "
Some of Royal Melbourne Hospital's IBD pregnancy clinic team, with patient Stephanie Aparo and her husband Ralph. Ms Aparo has ulcerative colitis and had twins in the\u00a0clinic a few years ago.(Supplied:\u00a0Britt Christensen)
", "When, six months into the pregnancy, Ms Zerbib's\u00a0condition worsened, the clinic was able to adjust her treatments safely for the foetus.", "Ms Zerbib's health improved\u00a0and the baby was closely monitored.", "Her daughter was safely delivered by C-section in February.", "\"When you have to manage all of the surprises of pregnancy, as well as your condition, it can be a lot,\" she said.", "\"I felt empowered, in terms of so much information and involvement in decisions, and advocated for \u2014\u00a0because the doctors were talking to each other.\"", "After giving birth Ms Zerbib had a \"small\" flare up, but says she was able to better manage Crohn's disease this time around with \"more proactive\" treatment.", "Her daughter is now more than eight months old and doing \"really well\".", "
More clinics needed
", "The RMH's multidisciplinary IBD pregnancy clinic was the first of its kind in Australia.", "There is now one in Sydney.", "As well as women with Crohn's disease or ulcerative colitis planning to get pregnant, they treat men..", "Many with the condition worry about the impact medications may have on unborn children.", "By having IBD specialists, obstetricians, pharmacists, nurses and surgeons all working together to help people before, during and after pregnancy the team can reassure them about safety.", "\"It's been fantastic,\" Dr Christensen\u00a0said.", "\"We have a pharmacist in our clinic who sees women ideally before they get pregnant, who can make sure they are on appropriate medication and see them throughout and just reassure them about the safety.", "\"The whole idea is to make sure everything goes as smoothly as possible.\""]
